og.description: They are called “high-frequency users,” calling 911 three or more times a month or 15 or more times year, chalking up costly emergency room visits that further strain an already over-loaded health care system. In Peoria, fire officials are looking to curb ER visits by the 100 to 120 city residents who regularly call 911 …
